FuncDef: The reset pim routing-table command clears interface status of the specified PIM routing entry. The reset pim routing-table command clears interface status of the specified PIM routing entry.
CLIs: reset pim routing-table group <groupAddr> mask { <group-mask-length> | <group-mask-addr> } source <sourceAddr> interface { <oif-port-type> <oif-port-num> | <oif-port-name> }

reset pim vpn-instance <vpn-instance-name> routing-tablegroup <groupAddr> mask { <group-mask-length> | <group-mask-addr> } source <sourceAddr> interface { <oif-port-type> <oif-port-num> | <oif-port-name> }

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the mask length of a multicast group address.
The value is an integer ranging from 4 to 32.

Specifies the mask of a multicast group address.
The value ranges from 128.0.0.0 to 255.255.255.255, in dotted decimal notation.

Specifies the source address of a PIM entry.
The value is in dotted decimal notation. If the specified PIM entry is a (*, G) entry, the source address is 0.0.0.0.

Specifies the name of an interface.
The value is a string of 1 to 63 case-sensitive characters. It cannot contain spaces.

Specifies the type of an interface.
-

Specifies the number of an interface.
The value is a string of 1 to 63 case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported.

Specifies the name of a VPN instance.
The value is a string of 1 to 31 case-sensitive characters. The VPN instance name cannot be _public_. The character string can contain spaces if it is enclosed with double quotation marks (").

Specifies the group address of a PIM entry.
The value ranges from 224.0.0.0 to 239.255.255.255, in dotted decimal notation.

Examples: <HUAWEI> reset pim routing-table group 225.0.0.1 mask 255.255.255.0 source 1.1.1.1 interface Vlanif 1
